alert.note: Alert for Coastal Bay; Coastal Franklin; Coastal Gulf; South Walton (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued August 30 at 10:13AM EDT until September 01 at 3:00AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT /1 AM CDT/ THURSDAY... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the High Surf Warning, dangerously large breaking waves of 7 to 11 feet expected in the surf zone. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Walton, Bay, Gulf, and Franklin County Beaches. * WHEN...For the High Surf Warning, continuing through 2 AM EDT /1 AM CDT/ Thursday. For the High Rip Current Risk, through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Breaking waves can sweep people off jetties and docks, and into dangerous seas. Life-threatening swimming conditions and significant beach erosion can be expected. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: Everyone should remain out of the water due to life-threatening surf conditions. Stay off of jetties, piers, and other waterside infrastructure. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Bay; Coastal Franklin; Coastal Gulf; South Walton
